trial_identification.studytitle: Randomized prospective trial of cyclosporine with/without low-dose prednisolone in idiopathic membranous nephropathy in adults with nephrotic syndrome
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Randomized prospective trial of cyclosporine with/without low-dose prednisolone in idiopathic membranous nephropathy in adults with nephrotic syndrome
trial_identification.trialacronym: CYPMEN (CYclosporine with/without Prednisolone in MEmbranous Nephropathy) study

conditions.healthcondition: idiopathic membranous nephropathy with nephrotic syndrome

interventions.interventions: Oral administration of cyclosporine 3 mg/kg/day and prednisolone 15 mg/day, for a total of 24 months
interventions.comparator: Oral administration of cyclosporine 3 mg/kg/day. for a total of 24 months

primaryOutcome.outcome: Rates of patients with complete remission or partial remission, and rates of patients with relapse or recurrence by urinaly examinations at the follow-up clinic visiting
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 24 months after the initiation of the treatment

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: until 24 months after the initiation of the treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: serum levels of protein and albumin (mg/dL)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: until 24 months after the initiation of the treatment
until 24 months after the initiation of the treatment
until 24 months after the initiation of the treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: adverse effects, such as liver injury, deterioration of renal function, and abnormalities of peripheral blood cell counts by questionnaries and medical examinations
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: until 24 months after the initiation of the treatment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
Biopsy proven idiopathic membranous nephropathy.
Over 3.5 g/day of excretion of urinary protein.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Secondary forms of membranous nephropathy. Less than 70 ml/min of creatinine clearance. Patients with relapse or recurrence. Treated with other immunosuppressants.
